intro: Malvaviscus oligotrichus, commonly known as the velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The plant is also known for its sticky, velvety texture on its leaves and stems.
